Why is this a British spelling article. The USA was in the World Cup starting in 1930. When did the small island nation of England first play?
rv this is a British English article
Revert spelling change. (Google spell-check reveals 199 million for "organize" and only 61.5 million for "organise").
Revert to revision 58592975 dated 2006-06-14 15:43:29 by Uris using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
In countries that call it soccer, the World Cup is almost always just called the World Cup (sometimes the FIFA World Cup).
/* World Cup summaries */ Korea and Japan
/* World Cup summaries */ Can't see stars at 20px, so used current version of flag - 50 stars, can't see 1 at 20px - with straight horizontal lines.
/* World Cup summaries */ Replaced 1938 flag for Hungary with pre-WWII flag
/* World Cup summaries */ Gave Spain the Franco flag for 1950.
/* World Cup summaries */ Replaced current Italy flag with Italian flag to 1946 for years prior to that.
/* World Cup summaries */ Link corrections; in 1934, Germany accepted 3rd place under the Nazi flag.
/* World Cup summaries */ De-bolded some host countries that were randomly bolded.
/* World Cup summaries */ Team entered as West Germany in these years.

/* World Cup summaries */ those games weren't finals or 3rd place matches - indeed, Brazil would have won the Cup had they drawn with Uruguay
